# init(inputPort:videoPreviewLayer:)

**Initializer**

Creates a capture connection that represents a connection between an input port and a video preview layer.

## Declaration

```swift
init(inputPort port: AVCaptureInput.Port, videoPreviewLayer layer: AVCaptureVideoPreviewLayer)
```

## Parameters

- **port**: An [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureInput/Port] instance that relates to an [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureInput] instance.
- **layer**: An [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureVideoPreviewLayer] instance.

## Return Value

A capture connection that represents a connection between `port` and `layer`.

## Discussion

You can add the connection this method returns to an [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession] instance with the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession/addConnection(_:)] method.

The [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession/addInput(_:)]: or [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession/addOutput(_:)] methods automatically form connections between all compatible inputs and outputs. You don’t need to manually create and add connections to the session unless you use the primitive [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession/addInputWithNoConnections(_:)] and [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureSession/addOutputWithNoConnections(_:)] methods.

## Creating a connection

- **init(inputPorts:output:)**: Creates a capture connection that represents a connection between multiple input ports and an output.
